question.text: The study of mutations is easy in haploids as compared to diploids, because

options.text: Haploids are more abundant in nature than diploids
All mutations, whether dominant or recessive are expressed in haploids
They are reproductively more stable than diploids
Mutagens penetrate in haploids more effectively than in diploids

solution.text: Haploids are the cells which have only one set of the chromosome or can say one of the pair of the alleles of gene. Since haploids are not having the whole pair of allele, thus its allele is not influenced or affected by the counterpart. All allele types gets expressed in a haploid. It is the choice of cell for studying mutations as even the recessive allele will get expressed and not just only the dominant type since the recessive allele is singular and not in pair.
